Inside Account Executive

Company Name Ento.com Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 23 hours ago Number of views 139 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Our sales team is growing and internal promotions mean we’re looking for an Inside Account Executive to join us! Work with market leading software, an awesome team, uncapped comms and tonnes of development opportunities.\xa0


About us
Ento enables businesses to automate, engage, optimise and succeed with their workforce - regardless of size or industry. We strive to take every last minute of wasted time out of HR and workforce management so our customers can spend more time on what matters most - their people.


Since its inception, Ento has become the chosen HR and workforce management solution for over 400 businesses across a range of industries - including retail, hospitality, security and healthcare. With the ability to scale to any size, and a score of unique customisation options, Ento helps a wide range of users - from Australian brands to international businesses - see the realities and the potential of their workforce laid out clearly and simply.

About you
You’ll be excited about the potential software has to solve business problems and enjoy engaging with a broad range of people to demonstrate value and present solutions.\xa0


Motivated by success, you’ll be goal driven and hungry to hit targets - all while leaving a trail of satisfied customers behind you.

The opportunity to work with a constantly evolving market-leading product inspires you and you’ll get satisfaction from working in a fast-paced, high performing environment.

If this sounds like you - we’d love to chat further!

What you’ll do

  • Focusing entirely on new business you will be hunting new opportunities and working on leads uncovered by our Sales Development (SDR) team
  • You’ll conduct demos and client engagements with small to medium businesses (30-300 employees) primarily via phone and webinar
  • Drive prospects through a structured sales cycle, conduct negotiations and drive revenue for Ento\xa0
  • Act as a trusted advisor in a complicated and competitive market\xa0
  • You’ll evangelise Ento with prospects, allowing them to understand why we are the only partner they should consider for HR transformation

Your background
  • Experience with B2B sales and an ability to understand business problems
  • Exposure to a wide range of industries and an understanding of the different business challenges they face
  • Confident presenting to an audience, you’ll be confident articulating solutions, demonstrating value and changing course in response to changing client needs
  • Demonstrated success closing deals with cold prospects\xa0
  • Strong negotiation skills & ability to manage multiple buying cycles at once
  • Experience with technology sales would be a big plus - and experience with HR or WFM technology even better!\xa0

What’s on offer
  • Trust – we’ll back you and trust you to deliver. You'll get to work autonomously while knowing the support is there if you need it
  • Collaborative team - you’ll be able to draw on the expertise of technical teams and industry experts to help you succeed
  • An amazing office aesthetic - seriously. We’re lucky enough to have custom designed offices with all the perks - coffee, ping-pong, free lunches and social events
  • Career growth - we believe in professional development and provide everyone with opportunities to attend training and courses that will help them achieve their goals
  • We pull off the impossible and you’ll love working with us!

Junior Legal Counsel

Company Name Herbert Smith Freehills Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 5 hours ago Number of views 665 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Would you like to work in an in-house role within a global leading law firm?\xa0
  • Are you a driven, high performing fee earner looking for a highly varied, generalist role?
  • Rare opportunity for a 2 yr+ PQE \xa0lawyer to join Herbert Smith Freehills’ General Counsel and Risk team.


Herbert Smith Freehills’ General Counsel & Risk team is seeking a Junior Legal Counsel to join them in Melbourne, on a permanent full-time basis. This role will support the Head of General Counsel & Risk, Australia and other members of the global General Counsel & Risk team (based in Australia and London) in the provision of legal advice to the firm and the achievement of the firm’s governance and professional risk management strategies. You will drive, promote and facilitate the effective implementation of the firm’s policies and procedures and have a significant role in providing advice and guidance to people at all levels of the firm.

\xa0

This role will work with our New Business Intake team, Business Services and partners, lawyers and support staff across all our practice groups. You will also work with the firm’s external regulators, including legal practice boards, ASIC and electoral funding authorities.

\xa0

Skills and experience:

\xa0

The successful candidate for this role will ideally have all of the following attributes:

  • Be legally qualified, with a current Victorian practising certificate
  • Have at least 2 years post admission experience in a leading law firm
  • Be a driven, high performing professional who is adept at simultaneously managing a number of complex tasks requiring a variety of skill sets
  • Be interested in developing a detailed knowledge of the business of a law firm with a risk management focus
  • Have excellent verbal and written communications skills, including the ability to write policies and reports and deliver formal and informal training sessions
  • Have demonstrated ability and confidence to deal autonomously with a variety of people, including partners, management and senior Business Services staff
  • Have the ability to effectively influence senior stakeholders
  • Have the ability to simplify complex concepts into simple to understand information
  • Have the ability to exercise sound judgment
  • Be able to balance risk considerations with commercial pragmatism
  • Have the ability to deliver results under pressure and deadlines

\xa0

The General Counsel & Risk group

\xa0

General Counsel & Risk is a global multi-disciplinary legal and analytical team. It consists of an internal legal advisory team, risk and compliance lawyers, internal audit, information security specialists, an enterprise risk team and a new business intake department. These disciplines work together globally to ensure that the firm fulfils all our governance, contractual regulatory and compliance obligations. The General Counsel & Risk team also advises on the firm's risk profile and helps a broad range of internal stakeholders to make risk-based decisions.


The broader team also supports the executive and governance boards, manages the firm’s insurance matters and has responsibility for implementing the firm's client and matter selection strategy. It advises our partners and lawyers to ensure that Herbert Smith Freehills remains a highly trusted advisor in a constantly changing world, and works with our Business Services professionals in managing risk on behalf of the firm and enabling high quality strategic and risk-based decisions to be made.


To Apply\xa0\xa0

Interested applicants who meet the above criteria can apply by clicking on the 'Apply' link and submitting a resume and academic transcript.

Senior Project Manager (Workplace Modernisation)

Company Name Department of Economic Development, Jobs, Transport and Resources Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 34 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Department of Economic Development, Jobs, Transport and Resources (DEDJTR) is the Victorian Government’s lead agency for creating the conditions to sustainably develop the Victorian economy and grow employment. Our role is to increase jobs, investment, exports and opportunities; stimulate innovation, competitiveness, and confidence; and support sustainability.

The Department is committed to building a culture where we say 'yes' to flexible work arrangements, and support ways of working that help employees balance work and home life. The Department is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applicants from a diverse range of backgrounds.

The Department strongly encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

The Department offers reasonable adjustments for applicants with disabilities on request.

SENIOR PROJECT MANAGER (WORKPLACE MODERNISATION)
  • $116,863 - $156,387 (Plus Superannuation)
  • Fixed Term (12 months)
  • Usual hours of work: Full Time (flexibility may be available)
  • Usual work location: Melbourne, CBD (flexibility may be available)

The position of Senior Project Manager forms a part of the Workplace Services Branch in People and Workplace Services within Corporate Services Group.

This position is responsible for the management of contemporary and agile office fit-out projects, contract and procurement activities to support the delivery of the departments accommodation strategy for sites in the CBD. The position is also required to play a vital role in ensuring that processes meet compliance and statutory obligations, expenditure is within agreed budget parameters, and reports are provided on a regular basis to management. The Senior Project Manager (Workplace Modernisation) will be expected to use structured methodology to plan, implement, monitor, manage risk, review and evaluate projects.

The incumbent will work effectively in a fast-paced environment, leading, coaching and motivating teams, enjoy flexible working arrangements and undertake a wide variety of work across the division.

The position requires a motivated self-starter who can build and maintain good working relationships with DEDJTR staff in business areas and corporate groups as well as external contractors, suppliers and facilities staff to ensure outcomes and expectations are met. This position will also manage several programs of work through to successful completion.

To Be Successful In This Role You Will Have
  • Extensive office fit-out experience (including the delivery of agile workplaces) and project management skills including strong planning skills
  • Demonstrated ability to manage organisational politics, understand sources of conflict, ensure conflicts of interest are managed properly, facilitate resolution and successfully broker consensus.
  • Strong stakeholder management and leadership skills
  • Demonstrated experience managing a program of works.

For a confidential discussion, please call Joanne Rumble, Director, Accommodation Strategy on (03) 9658 4752.

Successful candidates will be required to undergo a National Police Records Check prior to commencing employment with the Department.

For further information on the position, please see the attached position description. To apply, please click the ‘Apply Now' button below.

Applications close at midnight on 4 September 2018 and must address the Key Selection Criteria outlined in the Position Description.

Seniority Level

Associate

Industry

  • Nonprofit Organization Management
  • Research
  • Government Administration

Employment Type

Temporary

Job Functions

  • Project Management
  • Information Technology

Senior Quality Analyst (Payment Solutions)

Company Name MYOB Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 90 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Senior Quality Analyst (Payment Solutions)

Glen Waverley

Who Are We

We are a tech company that exists to help businesses succeed. Our team is continually growing, inventing and disrupting conventions. We believe businesses can do amazing things and it's our job to help them. This is MYOB.

The MYOB way

We simplify, we collaborate, we find new ways to innovate, we set goals, we smash goals and we always make the call. It’s the way we do things around here. We are inspired, authentic, and in the know… This is the MYOB Way.

What Team Will You Be a Part Of

You’ll be part of our new Payment Solutions division and join a growing engineering team responsible for building and operating a range of payment related products and services that will drive MYOB’s foray into the rapidly growing payment services sector.

We believe a large market exists within small and medium businesses to use core payments services to drive efficiencies in their business and to improve their cashflow requirements. The adoption of digital payments is on the rise and the growth of new and emerging payment channels such as digital wallets, e-invoicing, mobile devices, NPP, etc. means this is an exciting domain with endless opportunities.

We empower our teams to innovate and experiment when solving the important problems for our clients who are at the centre of everything we do. With the latest tech at your disposal and an agile mindset, we are looking for people who are passionate about making a difference and are ready to go boldly?

The opportunity

We care about delivering beautiful software and ensure that we apply the best practices to optimise quality of our products. As a Senior Quality Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in analysing, challenging and empowering your team to think about quality in all dimensions of software delivery.

Establishing relationships and empowering teams is the key to make quality assurance the center of thought as well as your genuine passion to improve MYOB’s products particularly around Payment solutions.

What You’ll Bring
  • Proven commercial experience as a Quality Analyst or Tester
  • Experience with quality assurance approaches and techniques, including test planning, test automation, TDD, functional and non-functional testing and exploratory testing
  • Experience with Relational Databases
  • Good understanding of Agile and different methodologies, such as Scrum, Kanban and Lean
  • Ability to establish relationships and demonstrate stakeholder management skills
  • Understanding of cloud solutions and cloud deployment is a plus
  • Detail oriented and meticulous
If you want to work in an environment where collaboration is key, your opinion is valued, and your ideas can make a difference, you need to work at MYOB. Apply now! We look forward to meeting you.

As a member of the Richmond Football Club Finance Team, the Accountant will play a significant role in the running of the day-to-day finance operations of the Club’s subsidiary company Aligned Leisure. Key responsibilities will include the preparation of monthly Profit & Loss Statements for a number of Aligned Leisure venues, compliance reporting and assisting Centre Managers with finance related requests and queries. The Accountant will work in conjunction with the other members of the Finance team to improve the overall finance function of the Club.

Who are we?

As an Australian-owned, Project Consultancy dedicated to optimising business performance through business analysis, change management and project delivery initiatives.

We enable this client capability uplift, through providing our Consulting (Project solutions), Resourcing (Project Management, Business Analysis & Change Management specialists) and/or project related certified Training services.

The opportunity


Our BA Practice is expanding, and as such we are seeking multiple, career oriented and passionate, Business Analysts (at all levels) who will participate in the journey of business transformation.


The opportunities consist of helping our clients across variety of business initiatives to uplift their capability.


Some current engagements look like this:

  • Financial Reporting
  • Telecommunications (Billing, Customer Experience, B2B)
  • High touch engagement – requirements modelling


And many more.

Your background

  • You demonstrate BA experience in project-based environments
  • You have a strong track record and understanding of successful business analysis principles
  • You have exposure to Consultancy environments across the following sectors – Government, Telecommunications, Financial Services (Insurance), Higher Education, Utilities or Not-for-Profit

MetaLife and Our Values

Respect - Everyone is treated equally

Ego (No) - We value, that no-one has all the answers and everyone can offer value

Extraordinary​ - We are always striving to do our best​ and be proud of our achievements

Client Centricity ​- The client (Customer and Staff) is at the heart of everything we do

Curiosity - We are forever the student​ and are inspired and energised by solving problems

Authenticity - We value and respect who you are and what you believe in - Don't go changing!

We reward our team and ensure your development is supported in alignment with your ambition.

Fundraising Coordinator

Company Name Save the Children Australia Company Location Carlton, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 56 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


Fundraising is our vocation. We take insights, creativity and innovation and turn them into the income that will fund life-saving and world-changing outcomes. We are passionate advocates on behalf of our donors, drawing on our knowledge of what inspires and motivates them to build genuine engagement in our shared cause.
Save the Children is no ordinary not-for-profit.
We're ambitious, creative and outspoken. We stand up for children's rights. We want all children to be educated, healthy and live a life free from violence. We run programs in Australia and overseas and, if there's a disaster - like an earthquake, drought or conflict - we are there on the ground.

Where you come in:
In this full-time permanent position based in our Carlton head office, you will work to grow supporter lifetime value through the creation and execution of targeted activities via print, digital and telemarketing channels. You will be part of our Donor Development team and report to our Supporter Growth Manager.

You will make an impact by:

  • Assisting with the creation and implementation of multi-channel campaigns to maximise response and income
  • Project managing and implementing campaign plans (i.e. timelines, creative briefs, data briefs)
  • Applying fundraising best practice and insights to review and provide constructive feedback on campaign copy and creative
  • Establishing and building strong working relationships with key internal partners to facilitate campaign implementation
  • Assisting with administrative tasks as required, such as invoicing, budget tracking and reporting


If we could compose the perfect you…
… You're a highly motivated individual with a passion for continuously improving supporter engagement. You can hit the ground running, using your project management talents, and building strong working relationships to deliver innovative and insight driven activities to grow supporter lifetime value. Your attention to detail is second-to-none, and you're able to apply your knowledge of fundraising best practice to edit and review communications. You're a team player who can work under pressure, with the flexibility to help the wider fundraising team where required.

This role requires:

  • Previous experience in delivering campaigns to drive financial growth or customer engagement
  • A sound understanding of direct marketing, digital, social media, data, audience targeting and segmentation
  • Strong project management skills, with the ability to drive a project to completion
  • High attention to detail, with strong written, interpersonal and verbal communications skills
  • The ability to analyse data efficiently and accurately to inform effective decision making.


Working at Save the Children is more than just a job.
It's the feeling of knowing that your work is contributing to making the world a better place for children and working with others who feel the same. We offer a competitive salary including generous salary packaging benefits, a friendly and flexible work environment, and great career opportunities - both locally and internationally.

Sound interesting?
We'd love to hear from you. Submit your cover letter and resume by clicking on one of the buttons in the 'Apply' section.

Applications close COB Wednesday 29th August 2018. For any enquiries, contact Monica on monica.rogers@savethechildren.org.au or 03 7002 1701.

We know diversity makes a positive difference, and we encourage people from Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander and other diverse backgrounds to apply.

Save the Children Australia is a child-safe organisation. All employees are required to undergo a National Police Check, a Working with Children Check where necessary, and sign our Child Protection Policy and Code of Conduct.

835026654:
[

Research Scientist in Cybersecurity - CSIRO's Data61 and the Cyber Security CRC

Company Name CSIRO's Data61 Company Location Docklands, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 42 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Excellent opportunity to work in a leading scientific institution with dedicated professionals
  • Add value through conducting research in cyber security
  • Join CSIRO’s Data61, the largest data innovation group in Australia


The Position

This is an exciting role that will help shape the effective secondary and meaningful use, including commercialisation of cyber security outcomes derived through industry led applied research and development. If successful, you will work closely with the Cyber Security Cooperative Research Centre (CyberCRC) and CSIRO’s Data61 Research in Distributed Systems Security


You will develop and engage in high quality, impactful research projects that contribute the cyber security of Australia and the role will focus on one of two themes of the CRC: Platform & Architecture for Cyber Security as a Service and Security Automation & Orchestration.

You will collaborate within the Data61 and also with the broader CyberCRC personnel and people from industry, government and other research organisations in developing industry led research that can be applied to real world cyber security challenges and produce a stream of research and development that contributes to high quality journal articles. This role will allow you to continually develop skills, experience, and research impact, with the objective of becoming a leading expert in the field.


Find out more by viewing the full position description and selection criteria here:

https://jobs.csiro.au/job/Negotiable-Research-Scientist-in-Cybersecurity-CSIRO's-Data61-and-the-Cyber-Security-CRC/500641800/


Your duties/responsibilities will include:

  • Under the direction of CyberCRC theme leaders, carry out innovative, impactful research of strategic importance to cyber security that will, where possible, lead to novel and important scientific outcomes, and industry applications.
  • Produce high quality scientific and/or engineering papers suitable for publication in quality journals and conferences.
  • Lead CyberCRC projects, and supervise CRC honours, masters and PhD students.\xa0


Location:\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Marsfield NSW or Docklands VIC
Salary:\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0AU$97K - AU$105K plus up to 15.4% superannuation
Tenure: \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 3 year specified term
Reference: \xa0 58357


To be successful you will need:

  • Proven ability to conduct high quality research, development and implementation in AI, Machine Learning, NLP and apply in different application domains, preferably in cyber security with publications in the top tier security conferences IEEE S&P, ACM CCS, NDSS, Usenix Security, or similar level conferences in other domains.
  • Demonstrated experience in conducting research activities in one of the research field such as Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing and Systems Security.
  • Experience in applying research outcomes in solving practical/industry problems, preferably in the area of security automation and software/application security.


Cyber Security Cooperative Research Centre (CyberCRC)

The CyberCRC has been funded for 7 years by the Commonwealth Government’s Cooperative Research Centres Program and has also attracted significant funding from its participants. The CyberCRC is an industry-driven collaboration to create and enhance Australian cyber security capability. With two research programs, ‘Critical Infrastructure Security’ and ‘Cyber Security Solutions as a Service’, the CyberCRC will deliver innovative research, education and training outcomes that solve core challenges for public and private sector partners, with flow on effects for broader industry and community. It will support the training and development of the future Australian cyber security workforce through traditional education programs with university and industry partners; cross-seed knowledge from a range of disciplines across industry and academia to influence innovative approaches to cyber security; and build awareness of cyber security habits and risks. The Cyber CRC has 25 participants which includes 19 industry and government entities and 6 universities.


The CyberCRC fosters collaboration with industry, academia, and government to deliver collaborative research outcomes articulated by industry and government. This research will solve real-world problems that organisations face today and that, in the future, we can deliver these solutions to industry, government and all Australians, while developing over the next 7 years the cyber security workforce of the future that will be embedded into our participant organisations.


CSIRO’s Data61 business unit is the largest data innovation group in Australia, bringing together approximately 600 research and development staff working in digital technologies to create benefit for Australia. Data61 develops Australia's future leaders with its strong 300+ PhD student program in collaboration with our best universities across Australia.


About CSIRO

We imagine. We collaborate. We innovate.


At CSIRO, we do the extraordinary every day. We innovate for tomorrow and help improve today – for our customers, all Australians and the world. We do this by using science and technology to solve real issues. Diversity is the compass that navigates our innovation. We provide an inclusive workplace that respects, values and actively pursues the benefits of a diverse workforce.\xa0


We work flexibly at CSIRO, offering a range of options for how, when and where you work. Talk to us about how this role could be flexible for you.


How to Apply:\xa0 To apply, please provide a CV as well as a cover letter addressing the selection criteria in brief, and upload these as one document. If your application proceeds to the next stage you may be asked to provide additional information.


Applications Close:\xa0 Open Till Filled

Java Developer

Company Name BAE Systems Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 5 days ago Number of views 109 views

Job description

The Applied Intelligence division of BAE Systems delivers solutions which protect and enhance the connected world. Everything we do creates a safer future.

We want to solve problems for our customers and by bringing together great minds, we can work together to make the world a safer place.

Job title

Java Developer

About Us

Everything we do creates a safer future. In a new age of cyber threats, our people have a shared vision to protect the connected world, to create and deliver intelligent global solutions across and ever changing technological (threat) landscape. We are obsessed about solving problems for our customers, we bring together great minds who face tough challenges on a daily basis, and are encourage to make a difference.

Together, we make the world a safer place.

Make everyday matter.

About The Role

As Java Developer you will become a member of our local engineering team based in Melbourne. We work closely with our Australian customers. We also belong to a large global engineering community across Applied Intelligence and work with engineering teams across many different locations and time zones.

The role requires willingness to tackle both short term challenging technical problems for our customers and work on more long term projects delivering new technology. You will be involved in the full engineering lifecycle working in a team environment supporting the delivery of specific pieces of work.
This also includes solving various technical challenges and you will assist in the deployment and support of Java applications to our customers.

Most of the time you will be working in a team with the support of other software engineers, architects, testers, and project manager to deliver a technical solution.

What You Will Be Doing
  • Work on client projects within software development teams.
  • Code, test, and document software for delivery into customer projects.
  • Analyse code defects and produce appropriate code fixes. Deliver high quality work to meet client expectations and project deadlines.
  • Collaborate with team members to integrate individual components seamlessly into our solutions.
  • Report progress to manager or team lead, highlighting issues before they become a problem.
  • Produce or validates schedule- and effort estimates and commit to assigned tasks.
  • Continually improve personal understanding of software engineering, frameworks, technical concepts, methods and measurements that underpin the Engineering disciplines and practices of BAE Systems.
  • Exploits appropriate software development methods, languages, libraries and techniques and applies these to software engineering tasks to realise the most effective outcome.


Essential

Skills and Experience
  • 1-2 years or more experience in object oriented software development.
  • Experience with Java 8 and Spring framework.
  • Experience with Jira and other Atlassian tools.
  • Deliver work to a high standard within agreed timescales.
  • Work within the development lifecycle appropriate to the project.
  • Demonstrate good verbal and written communication skills through an ability to reason logically, question appropriately and present technical information clearly and concisely.
  • Demonstrate competence in the application of technical knowledge and ability to quickly pick-up new concepts and expand knowledge.
  • Make contributions to project knowledge sharing (e.g. Wikis, SIGs, etc.).


Desirable
  • Experience with or knowledge of MySQL, CSS, AD/LDAP.
  • Experience working and communicating directly with customers.
  • Experience of working with Agile / XP methodology
  • Experience with or knowledge of continuous integration, code coverage, static analysis, test driven development.


Security Clearance is required for this vacancy. If you are not currently Security Cleared, you will need to be eligible for this and willing to go through the process. For more guidance on National Security Vetting please click here.

About BAE Systems Applied Intelligence

We help nations, governments and businesses around the world defend themselves against cyber crime, reduce their risk in the connected world, comply with regulation, and transform their operations. We do this using our unique set of solutions, systems, experience and processes.

Our success is down to our people. The changing nature of our business means that we’re constantly looking for the brightest talent to help us fulfil our ambitions. As an experienced professional, we’ll entrust you with responsibility; this means that you’ll have client contact, variety and support from day one.

We'll encourage and support you to develop your skills and reward you as you grow. Whatever your area of expertise, you'll be much more than just a job title; you'll be an integral part of the business where your individual contribution makes a difference every day. Great minds deserve great rewards, so we also offer a very competitive salary and benefits package.

Diversity and inclusion are integral to the success of BAE Systems Applied Intelligence. Staying competitive in today’s global marketplace requires an organisational culture where employees with varying perspectives, skills, life experiences and backgrounds – the best and brightest minds – can work together to achieve excellence and realise individual and organisational potential. We also welcome discussions about flexible working.

Division Overview: Commercial Solutions

BAE Systems has been in the business of protecting some of the world’s most important assets and networks for over 100 years. We apply the same techniques, intelligence and strategy used in defending nations and governments to businesses as well. That’s us – Commercial Solutions - a division of BAE Systems that specializes in providing businesses around the globe with the products and services they need to stay protected in today’s connected world.

We offer a broad portfolio of on premise, managed and cloud-based products and services that are proven to protect our clients against financial crime and persistent cyber attackers.

We aim to be a global industry-leading, cyber and financial crime products business and will do this by leveraging the BAE Systems brand and by delivering higher grade security solutions for our clients.

Help us secure a connected world by being an unseen hero. Apply now and be inspired.

Job description

Store Manager | Expression of Interest | Melbourne Northern or Eastern Suburbs | BIG W

Lead and inspire your team to drive transformational change at one of our stores in northern and eastern Melbourne.
  • Above market, competitive salary packaging
  • Develop a high performing, customer led team
  • Utilise your commercial acumen to achieve your BIG W vision
What We're Like

BIG W's best and most valued asset is its staff. We believe one of the most vital elements of driving success is our people and empowering our workforce to meet their goals and extend their skills is a big part of our business.
  • Unbeatable teams, unbeatable opportunity
  • Implement change initiatives and deliver on growth opportunities
  • Build relationships with community and key stakeholders
The Role

The Store Manager leads the store team to deliver the best shopping experience for our customers. You will be responsible for achieving sales targets by ensuring labour is allocated and routines are in place ensuring the right stock in the right place at the right time, merchandised according to Company standards and customers are served in a friendly and efficient manner.

About You

As Store Manager you will utilise your previous retail management experience to develop a high performing customer-focused leadership team. Your self-motivated nature will allow you to meet deadlines and oversee budgets in a rapidly changing environment. You will also have demonstrated leadership and motivational prowess.

Skills you will use everyday in this exciting role include-

  • Engage, empower and motivate
    • Plan and execute delivery of the BIG W strategy
    • Excellent communication and relationship management
    About BIG W

    BIG W is a modern, Australian Discount Department Store. WIth a heritage dating back to 1964 and now 186 stores across Australia we are proud of of our 52 year history. We are all about offering our customers choice, by designing products in-house that our customers want but by also offering them national and international brands that they know and trust.

Mid - Senior Developers

Company Name Moula Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 51 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About us


Want to join one of Australia’s fastest growing fintechs?\xa0 We have multiple roles for experienced Software Developers to join our talented team.


Moula is a better way to borrow money to grow your business. Once upon a time, getting a business loan meant spending 6-8 weeks filling in forms and then waiting around for approval. With Moula, you can apply online with no paperwork and no hassle, and have the funds in your account the next day.


We’ve developed a unique platform that will analyse a business’ data, making the process simple, fast, and friendly. But we’re not just a smart algorithm; we’re all about human interaction, which is why we have a team of real people who will get to know each business’ unique needs. Founded in Australia by an experienced team who are passionate about using technology to simplify finance, Moula continues to lead the market with our transparent pricing and responsible lending practices.


About the position

As we are a fast growth fintech creating our own product in house you will be working with the latest technology in an agile scrum environment. \xa0We are looking for flexible, team players who are self starters with a passionate interest in technology and innovative practices. This role will be a mix of developing new functionality and enhancing existing systems. \xa0

This includes:

  • Hands on software development and automated testing

  • Coordinating with internal resources and stakeholders in an Agile environment, \xa0ensuring that projects are delivered incrementally and always being able to pivot in order to deliver maximum value

  • Being involved in the design and evolution of our software platform

  • We build, test, deploy and maintain all of our software in a very DevOps mentality (there is no separate Ops team)

  • We believe in using the right tool for the job


About you

  • You are an experienced software developer, \xa0with excellent communication skills and a team-oriented approach

  • You have a \xa0passion for software engineering and best practices, and a \xa0willingness to mentor and work with developers at all levels of experience

  • You will be happy to make suggestions for improvements not only to the code but the whole tech stack and process used to deliver software

  • You have an active interest in new developments in I.T. and love to learn and bring new ideas to the team

  • You will have extensive experience with .Net technologies and the Microsoft development stack

  • Front end experience (any javascript framework) highly desirable

  • You'll also have experience with Agile processes

\xa0

Your skills

  • .Net software development, C# MVC, Web API

  • Angular (2+) or other Javascript platforms and nodejs

  • Agile methodology

  • Azure platform and/or experience with other cloud providers

  • Continuous integration and deployment

  • Database development, specifically SQL Server

  • Understanding of different types of architecture, like event based models and microservices

\xa0

We offer

  • An exciting opportunity to be a part of building our business

  • A relaxed, fun, friendly and supportive culture

  • A commitment to continuous learning and sponsored training

  • A flat structure with lots of autonomy and flexibility

  • Opportunities to advance your career and develop your skills and knowledge

  • Working in a small but growing team will allow you to put forward your ideas, try them out and see them implemented

\xa0\xa0

for more information about us please visit www.moula.com.au

Project Manager-Captial Works

Company Name RMIT University Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 97 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Project Manager-Captial Works
Job no: 570359
Work type: Full time - Continuing/Permanent
Categories: Building and Property Services
  • Full time, Permanent Position
  • $85,065-$92,077+ 17% Super
  • Convenient CBD location

Our Organisation

RMIT is a global university of technology, design and enterprise. Our mission is to help shape the world through research, innovation, teaching and engagement, and to create transformative experiences for our students, getting them ready for life and work.

Property Services is located in the Operations Portfolio which is the services nucleus of RMIT and the focus for the development of the finance, people development infrastructure and systems that provide administrative capacity to the University.

The Role & Your Responsibilities

The Project Manager is responsible for the delivery of allocated complex projects under the direction of management and under the supervision of the Senior Manager and Program Leader or Senior Project Manager.

The role will be capable of handling 3-5 projects at the same time and have a good understanding of various project management practices. This role will be responsibilities for investigating project user requirements, estimating project costing, monitoring the progress of projects and providing more complex technical expertise with the ability to resolve any issues or discrepancies.

This role will liaise with a variety of stakeholders across RMIT University and will liaise with external contacts such as architects, engineers, quality surveyors, building surveyors and contractors.

The Project Manager will work within the Capital Works Team and support the Senior Manager and Program Leader by applying best practice at all times and ensuring efficient and prompt delivery of service is achieved. This role will provide high level essential administrative tasks and maintain a high degree of internal and external customer service.

Skills & Experience Required
  • Knowledge and experience in managing and delivering a number of projects at the same time, meeting deadlines, quality standards and cost parameters, within a large complex organisation.
  • Demonstrated ability to inform, engage and coordinate with internal / external stakeholders such as consultants, stakeholders and contractors in a high volume work environment.
  • Good standard of verbal and written skills, negotiation and interacting skills with the ability to adapt styles of communication to suit all levels.
  • Demonstrated experience in providing regular updates on project progressions and outcomes
  • Thorough technical knowledge of all construction / professional disciplines conversant with the Victorian Building Regulations, Work cover, Occupational Health and Safety and other relevant standards.
  • Ability to manage the performance of contracts, programs and projects and effectively deliver results on time, and within budget for more than one project at a time.
  • Ability to understand and translate User requirements into sound technical specifications.

To ApplyTo view a position description, please visit http://yourcareer.rmit.edu.au and search using job #570359

 Project Manager_CW.pdf

Applications close on Sunday 9th September 2018

RMIT is an equal opportunity employer committed to being a child safe organisation. We are dedicated to attracting, retaining and developing our people regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability and age. Applications are encouraged from all sectors of the community.

Job description

MS BI EXPERT / POWER BI & AZURE EXPERT - MELBOURNE


My client, a major Australian consulting firm with operations in Sydney, Canberra, Melbourne and Perth, is currently looking for experienced Power BI + MS BI Stack Consultants in Brisbane and Melbourne.


The Power BI Consultant will be required to deliver an end-to-end Power BI solution. The ideal candidate will have the ability to pull various data sources together to build and deliver high-quality Microsoft Power BI reports. The role will entail working hands-on with data of varying quality and will require the ability and passion to use data to tell a story and report findings to the wider business.


Required Experience and Knowledge:

  • 3 years of commercial Microsoft Power BI experience plus 5 years' experience with MS SQL Server
  • 5 years' experience with SSRS (Reporting), SSIS (ETL development) and SSAS (Data modelling)
  • Strong stakeholder interaction skills

  • Cloud (AWS/Azure) experience
